channel.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
channel.description: Which do you think is better? People talk about how crap Mac is & then people say how crap Windows is. I use Windows (Vista) but I want to know your opinion.

item.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

[quote=“juju, post:9, topic:57763”][quote author=DeadBird link=topic=82639.msg892925#msg892925 date=1171336360]
Apple users are simply noobs who will believe anything they see in a commercial, as long as it agrees with the knee-jerk opinions they have already formed from other advertisements. In the final analysis Apple users are helpless slaves irrevocably wed to the mediated and hyper-hedonistic run away freight train of industrial society; thanks to iPods built with alien mind control technology they are unable to conceive of existence outside of music, video, and images. It is these legions of iPod wearing zombies with their thick black framed glasses and trendy shiny hair who are the Storm-Troopers of the ‘Great-Beast’. See, Protocols of the Elders of Macintosh.
[/quote]

You could say the exact same thing about Windows users and Zune owners.

Anywho, I like Mac OS X, I use it every day at school. I’m playing with the idea of buying a MacBook, the only problem is the cost. It’s nice to look at, and seems to be quite secure.[/quote]
I wouldn’t say for Windows USERS - only fanboys.
Zuners however - yes, its a flop. only hardcore MS stoolies will buy it.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
item.dc:creator: @93dcthugs93 93dcthugs93
item.description:
@93dcthugs93 wrote:

I really like Mac’s but they are a bit confusing, Windows are much more compatible though… because yes, mostly everything you download is for Windows nowadays.

But thats not the only reason, I’m more familiar with Windows :P. I have a Mac somewhere in my closet that I don’t use & I was thinking about hooking it up & using it for something, but sorta wanted to know weather I should just sell or or something & just get a new Windows system.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I haven’t used a Mac yet, although as I’ve said on another thread, a friend doing his media course work, managed to get the screen zoom all the way in on the mouse pointer.

Quote from my teacher: “Windows is a lot easier to use but Macs are so much better computers.”
All the windows PC’s there have 2.8Ghz+ processors with 256 mb ram, so I’m not sure about this one.

Lets look at some good and bad points:
Mac Good points:
Rarely get spyware/viruses.
Mac Bad points:
Not beginner friendly, unless you like reading manuals.

Windows Good points:
Easy to use, (this isn’t a good point for linux fan that use Windows, or people who know how to get “free software”) dominates the software market. A lot of sold programs now are solely for windows.
Windows Bad points:
Easy to get spyware/viruses unless you know what your doing.

My decision: unresolved. I haven’t ever used a Mac OS X so my vote would be unfair. I’ll be using a Mac OS X in my coursework(probably in 1-2 weeks) so I’ll get back to this thread then.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

DeadBird:

Apple users are simply noobs who will believe anything they see in a commercial, as long as it agrees with the knee-jerk opinions they have already formed from other advertisements. In the final analysis Apple users are helpless slaves irrevocably wed to the mediated and hyper-hedonistic run away freight train of industrial society; thanks to iPods built with alien mind control technology they are unable to conceive of existence outside of music, video, and images. It is these legions of iPod wearing zombies with their thick black framed glasses and trendy shiny hair who are the Storm-Troopers of the ‘Great-Beast’. See, Protocols of the Elders of Macintosh.

You could say the exact same thing about Windows users and Zune owners.

Anywho, I like Mac OS X, I use it every day at school. I’m playing with the idea of buying a MacBook, the only problem is the cost. It’s nice to look at, and seems to be quite secure.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows or Mac OS X?
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:


Mac users were once the most annoying computer fans on the planet. Now they are the second most annoying, after Linux users. They are continuously bragging about how easy a one-button mouse is, how great the benefits of the “genie” effect are, and act like BSD was just invented. Unfortunately, if you want to be famous, you have to be a Mac user.
Apple users are simply noobs who will believe anything they see in a commercial, as long as it agrees with the knee-jerk opinions they have already formed from other advertisements. In the final analysis Apple users are helpless slaves irrevocably wed to the mediated and hyper-hedonistic run away freight train of industrial society; thanks to iPods built with alien mind control technology they are unable to conceive of existence outside of music, video, and images. It is these legions of iPod wearing zombies with their thick black framed glasses and trendy shiny hair who are the Storm-Troopers of the ‘Great-Beast’. See, Protocols of the Elders of Macintosh.

Read full topic
